intro: Saponaria × composita, commonly known as the hybrid carnation, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and red, blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often tinged with purple. It is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Saponaria × composita is also noted for its mild saponin content, which can produce a soapy lather when crushed.
